2:Tcc0,{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Recipe","name":"Fugazzeta","description":"A thick double-crust Argentine pizza stuffed with oozing mozzarella cheese and topped with sweet caramelized onions. Born in the pizzerías of Buenos Aires, fugazzeta is the ultimate expression of Italian-Argentine pizza culture.","image":"https://expatsargentina.com/images/recipes/fugazzeta.webp","author":{"@type":"Organization","name":"Expats Argentina"},"datePublished":"2025-01-01","prepTime":"PT30M","cookTime":"PT25M","totalTime":"PT55M","recipeYield":"6 servings","recipeCategory":"main","recipeCuisine":"Argentine","keywords":"fugazzeta recipe, argentine pizza, stuffed onion pizza, fugazzeta argentina, buenos aires pizza","nutrition":{"@type":"NutritionInformation","calories":"480 calories","proteinContent":"22g","carbohydrateContent":"52g","fatContent":"22g"},"recipeIngredient":["For the dough: 500g (4 cups) bread flour","For the dough: 325ml (1⅓ cups) warm water","For the dough: 10g (1 packet) active dry yeast","For the dough: 2 tbsp olive oil","For the dough: 1 tsp sugar","For the dough: 1½ tsp salt","For the filling and topping: 400g (14 oz) low-moisture mozzarella, shredded","For the filling and topping: 4 large white onions, thinly sliced into rings","For the filling and topping: 3 tbsp olive oil (for caramelizing onions)","For the filling and topping: 1 tsp dried oregano","For the filling and topping: Coarse salt for finishing"],"recipeInstructions":[{"@type":"HowToStep","position":1,"text":"Dissolve yeast and sugar in warm water. Let stand 10 minutes until foamy. Add olive oil."},{"@type":"HowToStep","position":2,"text":"Combine flour and salt in a large bowl. Add the yeast mixture and stir until a shaggy dough forms. Knead on a floured surface for 10 minutes until smooth and elastic."},{"@type":"HowToStep","position":3,"text":"Place dough in an oiled bowl, cover with a damp towel, and let rise in a warm spot for 1 hour until doubled."},{"@type":"HowToStep","position":4,"text":"While dough rises, caramelize the onions: heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-low heat. Add sliced onions with a pinch of salt and cook slowly for 25-30 minutes, stirring occasionally, until deep golden and sweet. Set aside."},{"@type":"HowToStep","position":5,"text":"Punch down the dough and divide into two pieces — one slightly larger than the other. Roll the larger piece into a circle and press into an oiled 14-inch round baking pan, pushing dough up the sides."},{"@type":"HowToStep","position":6,"text":"Spread all the shredded mozzarella evenly over the bottom crust."},{"@type":"HowToStep","position":7,"text":"Roll out the second piece of dough and lay it over the cheese. Press the edges together firmly to seal, crimping all around."},{"@type":"HowToStep","position":8,"text":"Spread the caramelized onions generously over the top crust. Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with oregano and coarse salt."},{"@type":"HowToStep","position":9,"text":"Bake at 450°F (230°C) on the lowest oven rack for 20-25 minutes until the crust is golden and the cheese is visibly melted and bubbling at the edges."},{"@type":"HowToStep","position":10,"text":"Let rest 5 minutes before slicing into squares (porteño style, not triangles)."}]}0:{"buildId":"XJ7f5RvYDcX4yjbAXmNYG","rsc":["$","$1","c",{"children":[["$","div",null,{"className":"min-h-screen bg-gradient-to-b from-orange-50 to-white","children":[["$","script",null,{"type":"application/ld+json","dangerouslySetInnerHTML":{"__html":"$2"}}],"$L3","$L4","$L5","$L6"]}],null,"$L7"]}],"loading":null,"isPartial":false}
3:["$","div",null,{"className":"border-b bg-white/80 backdrop-blur-sm sticky top-0 z-40 print:hidden","children":["$","div",null,{"className":"max-w-5xl mx-auto px-4 py-4","children":["$","div",null,{"className":"flex items-center justify-between","children":["$","$L8",null,{"href":"/food/recipes","children":[["$","svg",null,{"xmlns":"http://www.w3.org/2000/svg","width":24,"height":24,"viewBox":"0 0 24 24","fill":"none","stroke":"currentColor","strokeWidth":2,"strokeLinecap":"round","strokeLinejoin":"round","className":"lucide lucide-arrow-left w-4 h-4","aria-hidden":"true","children":[["$","path","1l729n",{"d":"m12 19-7-7 7-7"}],["$","path","x3x0zl",{"d":"M19 12H5"}],"$undefined"]}],"All Recipes"],"data-slot":"button","data-variant":"ghost","data-size":"sm","className":"inline-flex items-center justify-center whitespace-nowrap text-sm font-medium transition-all disabled:pointer-events-none disabled:opacity-50 [&_svg]:pointer-events-none [&_svg:not([class*='size-'])]:size-4 shrink-0 [&_svg]:shrink-0 outline-none focus-visible:border-ring focus-visible:ring-ring/50 focus-visible:ring-[3px] aria-invalid:ring-destructive/20 dark:aria-invalid:ring-destructive/40 aria-invalid:border-destructive hover:bg-accent hover:text-accent-foreground dark:hover:bg-accent/50 h-8 rounded-md px-3 has-[>svg]:px-2.5 gap-2","ref":null}]}]}]}]

e:["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card","className":"bg-card text-card-foreground flex flex-col gap-6 rounded-xl border py-6 shadow-sm print:shadow-none print:border-gray-300","children":[["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card-header","className":"@container/card-header grid auto-rows-min grid-rows-[auto_auto] items-start gap-2 px-6 has-data-[slot=card-action]:grid-cols-[1fr_auto] [.border-b]:pb-6 pb-3","children":["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card-title","className":"font-semibold flex items-center gap-2 text-lg","children":[["$","svg",null,{"xmlns":"http://www.w3.org/2000/svg","width":24,"height":24,"viewBox":"0 0 24 24","fill":"none","stroke":"currentColor","strokeWidth":2,"strokeLinecap":"round","strokeLinejoin":"round","className":"lucide lucide-store w-5 h-5 text-orange-600","aria-hidden":"true","children":[["$","path","slp6dd",{"d":"M15 21v-5a1 1 0 0 0-1-1h-4a1 1 0 0 0-1 1v5"}],["$","path","o0xfot",{"d":"M17.774 10.31a1.12 1.12 0 0 0-1.549 0 2.5 2.5 0 0 1-3.451 0 1.12 1.12 0 0 0-1.548 0 2.5 2.5 0 0 1-3.452 0 1.12 1.12 0 0 0-1.549 0 2.5 2.5 0 0 1-3.77-3.248l2.889-4.184A2 2 0 0 1 7 2h10a2 2 0 0 1 1.653.873l2.895 4.192a2.5 2.5 0 0 1-3.774 3.244"}],["$","path","wn3emo",{"d":"M4 10.95V19a2 2 0 0 0 2 2h12a2 2 0 0 0 2-2v-8.05"}],"$undefined"]}],"Where to Try It"]}]}],["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card-content","className":"px-6 pt-0","children":["$","ul",null,{"className":"space-y-2","children":[["$","li","0",{"className":"text-sm text-gray-600 flex items-start gap-2","children":[["$","span",null,{"className":"text-orange-500 mt-1","children":"•"}],"Pizzería Güerrín (Av. Corrientes 1368, BA) — legendary since 1932"]}],["$","li","1",{"className":"text-sm text-gray-600 flex items-start gap-2","children":[["$","span",null,{"className":"text-orange-500 mt-1","children":"•"}],"El Cuartito (Talcahuano 937, BA) — classic porteño pizzería"]}],["$","li","2",{"className":"text-sm text-gray-600 flex items-start gap-2","children":[["$","span",null,{"className":"text-orange-500 mt-1","children":"•"}],"Banchero (Av. Corrientes 1300, BA) — claims to have invented fugazzeta"]}]]}]}]]}]
f:["$","div",null,{"className":"lg:col-span-2 space-y-6","children":[["$","div",null,{"className":"flex items-center gap-4 text-sm print:hidden","children":[["$","span",null,{"className":"text-gray-500","children":"Jump to:"}],["$","a",null,{"href":"#instructions","className":"text-orange-600 hover:underline","children":"Instructions"}],["$","a",null,{"href":"#tips","className":"text-orange-600 hover:underline","children":"Tips"}],["$","a",null,{"href":"#history","className":"text-orange-600 hover:underline","children":"History"}]]}],["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card","className":"bg-card text-card-foreground flex flex-col gap-6 rounded-xl border py-6 shadow-sm print:shadow-none print:border-gray-300","id":"instructions","children":[["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card-header","className":"@container/card-header grid auto-rows-min grid-rows-[auto_auto] items-start gap-2 px-6 has-data-[slot=card-action]:grid-cols-[1fr_auto] [.border-b]:pb-6","children":["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card-title","className":"font-semibold text-xl","children":"Instructions"}]}],["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card-content","className":"px-6","children":["$","ol",null,{"className":"space-y-6","children":[["$","li","0",{"className":"flex gap-4","children":[["$","div",null,{"className":"flex-shrink-0 w-8 h-8 rounded-full bg-orange-100 text-orange-600 flex items-center justify-center font-bold text-sm","children":1}],["$","p",null,{"className":"text-gray-700 leading-relaxed pt-1","children":"Dissolve yeast and sugar in warm water. Set aside."}]]}],["$","li","4",{"className":"flex gap-4","children":[["$","div",null,{"className":"flex-shrink-0 w-8 h-8 rounded-full bg-orange-100 text-orange-600 flex items-center justify-center font-bold text-sm","children":5}],["$","p",null,{"className":"text-gray-700 leading-relaxed pt-1","children":"Punch down the dough and divide into two pieces — one slightly larger than the other. 19:["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card","className":"text-card-foreground flex flex-col gap-6 rounded-xl border py-6 shadow-sm bg-gradient-to-br from-amber-50 to-orange-50 border-amber-100 print:bg-none print:border-gray-300","id":"tips","children":[["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card-header","className":"@container/card-header grid auto-rows-min grid-rows-[auto_auto] items-start gap-2 px-6 has-data-[slot=card-action]:grid-cols-[1fr_auto] [.border-b]:pb-6","children":["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card-title","className":"font-semibold flex items-center gap-2 text-xl","children":[["$","svg",null,{"xmlns":"http://www.w3.org/2000/svg","width":24,"height":24,"viewBox":"0 0 24 24","fill":"none","stroke":"currentColor","strokeWidth":2,"strokeLinecap":"round","strokeLinejoin":"round","className":"lucide lucide-lightbulb w-5 h-5 text-amber-600","aria-hidden":"true","children":[["$","path","1gvzjb",{"d":"M15 14c.2-1 .7-1.7 1.5-2.5 1-.9 1.5-2.2 1.5-3.5A6 6 0 0 0 6 8c0 1 .2 2.2 1.5 3.5.7.7 1.3 1.5 1.5 2.5"}],["$","path","x1upvd",{"d":"M9 18h6"}],["$","path","ceow96",{"d":"M10 22h4"}],"$undefined"]}],"Pro Tips from the Kitchen"]}]}],["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card-content","className":"px-6","children":["$","ul",null,{"className":"space-y-3","children":[["$","li","0",{"className":"flex items-start gap-3","children":[["$","span",null,{"className":"text-amber-500 mt-1","children":"✦"}],["$","p",null,{"className":"text-gray-700","children":"The dough should be wetter and softer than Italian pizza dough — this gives it the characteristic thick, bready texture of Buenos Aires pizza."}]]}],["$","li","1",{"className":"flex items-start gap-3","children":[["$","span",null,{"className":"text-amber-500 mt-1","children":"✦"}],["$","p",null,{"className":"text-gray-700","children":"Caramelizing the onions properly is non-negotiable. Low heat and patience turn them from harsh to sweet and jammy."}]]}],["$","li","2",{"className":"flex items-start gap-3","children":[["$","span",null,{"className":"text-amber-500 mt-1","children":"✦"}],["$","p",null,{"className":"text-gray-700","children":"Seal the edges well or the melted cheese will escape during baking."}]]}]]}]}]]}]
1a:["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card","className":"bg-card text-card-foreground flex flex-col gap-6 rounded-xl border py-6 shadow-sm print:shadow-none print:border-gray-300","id":"history","children":[["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card-header","className":"@container/card-header grid auto-rows-min grid-rows-[auto_auto] items-start gap-2 px-6 has-data-[slot=card-action]:grid-cols-[1fr_auto] [.border-b]:pb-6","children":["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card-title","className":"font-semibold flex items-center gap-2 text-xl","children":[["$","svg",null,{"xmlns":"http://www.w3.org/2000/svg","width":24,"height":24,"viewBox":"0 0 24 24","fill":"none","stroke":"currentColor","strokeWidth":2,"strokeLinecap":"round","strokeLinejoin":"round","className":"lucide lucide-history w-5 h-5 text-orange-600","aria-hidden":"true","children":[["$","path","1357e3",{"d":"M3 12a9 9 0 1 0 9-9 9.75 9.75 0 0 0-6.74 2.74L3 8"}],["$","path","1xhq8a",{"d":"M3 3v5h5"}],["$","path","1fdv2h",{"d":"M12 7v5l4 2"}],"$undefined"]}],"The Story Behind the Dish"]}]}],["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card-content","className":"px-6","children":["$","p",null,{"className":"text-gray-700 leading-relaxed","children":"Fugazzeta evolved from the Italian fugazza (focaccia with onions), brought to Buenos Aires by Genovese immigrants in the late 1800s. Porteño pizzerias added a second layer of dough and stuffed it with mozzarella, creating something entirely new. The iconic Pizzería Güerrín on Corrientes Avenue has served fugazzeta since 1932 and remains one of the best places to try it."}]}]]}]
1b:["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card","className":"bg-card text-card-foreground flex flex-col gap-6 rounded-xl border py-6 shadow-sm print:shadow-none print:border-gray-300","children":[["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card-header","className":"@container/card-header grid auto-rows-min grid-rows-[auto_auto] items-start gap-2 px-6 has-data-[slot=card-action]:grid-cols-[1fr_auto] [.border-b]:pb-6 pb-3","children":["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card-title","className":"font-semibold text-lg","children":"Storage & Leftovers"}]}],["$","div",null,{"data-slot":"card-content","className":"px-6 pt-0","children":["$","p",null,{"className":"text-gray-700","children":"Refrigerate leftover slices for up to 2 days. Reheat in a 400°F (200°C) oven for 8-10 minutes until cheese is melted again. Do not microwave — the crust will go soggy."}]}]]}]
